Package edu.uoc.uocnejitos.model

Class Move

java.lang.Object
edu.uoc.uocnejitos.model.Move
public class Move
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents the move coordinates for the game. Since move will be used in multiple classes (mainly movable pieces) it is easier to represent the start and end points of a move using one object.
Author:
David García Solórzano

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Coordinate coordEnd
    Coordinate object of the cell in which the move ends.
    private Coordinate coordStart
    Coordinate object of cell where the move starts.

    • Move

      public Move​(int xStart, int yStart, int xEnd, int yEnd)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      xStart - Row's starting cell.
      yStart - Column's starting cell.
      xEnd - Row's ending cell.
      yEnd - Column's ending cell.

      Constructor
      Parameters:

      coordEnd - Ending cell

    • getDirection

      public MoveDirection getDirection()
      This method is used to compute the direction of movement. Since each piece has move restrictions, this method will be used to initially determine if a move is valid.
      Returns:
      MoveDirection HORIZONTAL, VERTICAL, INVALID.

    • getHorizontalDistance

      public int getHorizontalDistance()
      This method calculates the distance that the object needs to move in the x axis (columns). The sign indicates the direction: + is right, - is left.
      Returns:
      the distance in the Horizontal direction.

    • getVerticalDistance

      public int getVerticalDistance()
      This method calculates the distance that the object needs to move in the y axis (rows). The sign indicates the direction: + is down, - is up.
      Returns:
      the distance in the Vertical direction.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the piece.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      String with the following format: (rowStart,columnStart) --> (rowEnd,columnEnd) : Direction
